message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is exhibiting signs of amphetamine toxicity, including hyperthermia, agitation, and hypertension. Sudden cardiac arrest is a life-threatening complication of amphetamine toxicity and can occur due to cardiac arrhythmias. Malignant hyperthermia is not associated with amphetamine toxicity. Respiratory depression and seizures may occur but are not as immediately life-threatening as sudden cardiac arrest.
